definition: for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
fence/railing/hurdle/column or box (of text or other data)

sentences.english: For technology columnists, it's a gift that keeps on giving.
sentences.chinese: 對技術專欄作家來說，這是個持續不斷贈予的禮物。

sentences.english: Earlier installments of this column have already touched on several others.
sentences.chinese: 本專欄的前面幾個部分已經談到了另外幾種風格。

sentences.english: Editors have reason for jacking up their women's pages.
sentences.chinese: 編輯們有理由將其婦女專欄辦得更生動一些。

sentences.english: The magazine used to have a regular how-to section.
sentences.chinese: 這本雜誌以前有一個定期的“教你做”專欄。

sentences.english: And as I pointed out in my last column, we can afford to do this.
sentences.chinese: 我在上次的專欄文章中曾說，我們是能夠做到的。

sentences.english: I write op-eds for GT's English edition (and China Daily).
sentences.chinese: 我給《環球時報》的英文版以及中國日報的專欄寫稿。

sentences.english: The editors have jacked up their sports pages.
sentences.chinese: 編輯們把體育專欄編得生動活潑。

sentences.english: Nominalization is the major realization of the ideational grammatical metaphor in opinion columns.
sentences.chinese: 評論專欄中的概念語法隱喻以名物化爲主要表現形式。

sentences.english: This is why our next four columns will deal with buffer overflow.
sentences.chinese: 這就是下面四個專欄將討論緩衝區溢位的原因。

sentences.english: The writer is a Specialist Writer of Lianhe Zaobao.
sentences.chinese: 作者是聯合早報的一位專欄作家。

sentences.english: I began tracking the columnists’ pronouncements with some ardor.
sentences.chinese: 我開始帶着某種狂熱追蹤專欄作家的文章。

sentences.english: I'm writing a column about rhododendrons right now.
sentences.chinese: 我正在寫一篇杜鵑方面的專欄文章。

sentences.english: He used to write a column for this newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他過去曾爲這家報紙寫專欄文章。

sentences.english: In other columns I have emphasized documentation and thoroughness.
sentences.chinese: 在其它專欄文章中，我已經強調了文檔編制和徹底性。

sentences.english: He filled neatly two columns of the single-sheet issue with his article.
sentences.chinese: 他完美的將他的文章寫在兩個單個問題的專欄裏。

sentences.english: But this is my 99th column and that makes a man feel reckless.
sentences.chinese: 不過，這是我第99篇專欄，我感到分外膽大。

definition: regular column or segment (in a publication or broadcast program)/program (TV or radio)
specific topic (addressed by a book, lecture, TV program etc)/article, report or program etc on a specific topic
to interview (a particular person or on a particular topic)/special interview/special report based on such an interview
pertaining to/concerning/with regard to/about/a matter of
to interview/to gather news/to hunt for and collect/to cover
